titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Samuel Woods, Indictment
CWG5433

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bourbon CIRCUIT COURT.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST }
Samuel Woods

THE GRAND JURY of Bourbon county, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Samuel Woods of the offence of Disorderly house committed as follows, viz: The said Samuel Woods of the 20th day of April 1860 in the county aforesaid, and on divers other days and times in said County did keep, and still keeps an a certain ill-governed and disorderly house in which he permits divers persons young & old to assemble & remain, drinking, tippling card playing, carousing, shouting yelling cursing swearing & misbehaving themselves in divers other disorderly obstreperous and improper ways to the great annoyance and disturbance of divers good citizens of this Commonwealth and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

W. S. DOWNEY,
COMMONWEALTH'S ATTORNEY.
WITNESSES:
A Copy att James Patron C. B. C. C.
The Commonwealth of Ky
vs } Indictment Dis House
Samuel WoodsA True Bill
N A. Rogers Foreman
Filed April 21st 1860
July- Continued
